summary: JAMES P. KELLY was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list KELLY's name, salary, and employment dates. He appears in payroll certifications for April 1978 and certification reports for August and December 1978. These documents indicate that KELLY was employed by the SCA during this period, likely in an administrative or support role, given the nature of the documents.
significance: The significance of JAMES P. KELLY in the JFK assassination context is related to his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the documents do not specify his exact role, his presence on the payroll indicates he contributed to the committee's investigation. The documents do not provide enough information to determine the extent or nature of his contribution.
